lead_paragraph: Your article was so offensive that it is difficult to know where to begin. You can regard the relegation of California's black students to second-tier schools as good news, as James Traub does, only if you assume that blacks are second-class citizens. While denouncing affirmative action, your writer supports ''fiddling'' with entrance requirements; he would have us ''fiddle'' while we burn. Julian Bond Chairman, National Association for the Advancement of Colored People Washington
abstract: NAACP chairman Julian Bond letter calls James Traub's May 27 article on affirmative action policies in California so offensive that it is difficult to begin to comment on article
